description: Alterations to provide a flexible space for community use and preserve and create a publicly accessible home for the Chapel's fascinating 200-year-old uncatalogued Collection. Works include the partial demolition of a roof to facilitate the infilling of a lightwell, a further lightwell will be infilled to the north of the site, the installation of an Air Handling Unit on the new infill roof and associated ductwork to the main roof structure, reroofing and replacement of the existing Sunday School roof, the installation of secondary glazing, insertion of a dumbwaiter, installation of glass balustrade at first floor level, upgrading of WC's and general repairs / redecoration.  (Full Planning application Ref: P2019/3302 also submitted).
decision_conditions:
3 YEAR CONSENT PERIOD FOR LBC: The works hereby permitted shall be begun not later than three years from the date of this consent.

REASON: To comply with the provisions of Section 18(1)(a) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 as amended by the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004 (Chapter 5).

application_details.lead_developer_company_name: Historic England - (Planning Applications and Grade I & II* listed)
